sen.j: 女性天皇（じょせいてんのう）とは、女性の天皇のこと。
sen.e: It means Emperor who was woman.
It means Emperor who was woman.
It means Emperor who was woman.

sen.j: 古くから女帝（呉音じょてい、漢音にょたい）と呼ばれることが多かったが、皇位継承問題の議論が盛んとなった2004年以降、日本の公文書や報道等では女性天皇の表現が用いられるようになった。
sen.e: They were often called Female Emperor (Jotei in Goon, Nyotai n Karagoe), after there was active argument of the issue of Imperial succession since 2004, they were commonly called female Emperor in an official document or in the publication.

They were often called Female Emperor (Jotei in Goon, Nyotai n Karagoe), after there was active argument of the issue of Imperial succession since 2004, they were commonly called female Emperor in an official document or in the publication.

They were often called female Emperor (they were also called Jotei in Goon and Nyotai in Karagoe), after there was active argument of the issue of Imperial succession since 2004, they were commonly called female Emperor in an official document or in the publication.
sen.cmt: they were also called補足スペル

sen.j: 概説
sen.e: The summary
The summary
Summary

sen.j: 日本では過去に8人10代の女性天皇が存在した。
sen.e: There were eight female emperors in ten generations in Japanese history.
There were eight female emperors in ten generations in Japanese history.
There were eight female emperors in ten generations in Japanese history.

sen.j: 神功皇后や飯豊皇女を含め彼女らはすべて男系皇族である女性（男系女性天皇）であり、かつ既婚の場合は、即位に先立ち天皇の妻（皇后）で夫は故人だったものである。
sen.e: All the female Emperors including Empress Jingu and Iitoyo no himemiko (Princess Iitoyo) were female Imperial members of the male line in the Imperial family (Female Emperors of male line), when they were married, they were Emperor's Empresses before the succession to the throne and the husbands(Emperors) previously passed away.

All the female Emperors including Empress Jingu and Iitoyo no himemiko (Princess Iitoyo) were female Imperial members of the male line in the Imperial family (Female Emperors of the male line), when they were married, they were Emperor's Empresses before succession to the throne and the husbands (Emperors) previously passed away.

All the female Emperors including Empress Jingu and Iitoyo no himemiko (Princess Iitoyo) were female Imperial members of the male line in the Imperial Family (Female Emperors of the male line), when they were married, they were Emperor's Empresses before succession to the throne and the husbands (Emperors) previously passed away.

sen.j: その内の6人8代は6世紀末から8世紀後半に集中している。
sen.e: These six female Emperors in eight generations were all in between the late 6 century to the late eight century.
These six female Emperors in eight generations were all in between the late 6th century and the late 8th century.
These six female Emperors in eight generations were all in between the late 6th century and the late 8th century.

sen.j: 推古天皇（在位592年～628年）（第33代）
sen.e: Emperor Suiko (her reign was 592 - 628) (the thirty third)
Emperor Suiko (her reign was 592 - 628) (the thirty third)
Emperor Suiko (her reign was 592 - 628) (the thirty third)

sen.j: 皇極天皇（在位642年～645年）（第35代）
sen.e: Emperor Kogyoku (her reign was 642 - 645) (the thirty fifth)
Emperor Kogyoku (her reign was 642 - 645) (the thirty fifth)
Emperor Kogyoku (her reign was 642 - 645) (the thirty fifth)

sen.j: 斉明天皇（在位655年～661年）（第37代、皇極天皇の重祚）
sen.e: Emperor Saimei (her reign was 655 - 661) (the thirty seventh) (the second accession to the imperial throne on Emperor Kogyoku)
Emperor Saimei (her reign was 655 - 661) (the thirty seventh) (the second accession to the imperial throne of Emperor Kogyoku)
Emperor Saimei (her reign was 655 - 661) (the thirty seventh, the second accession to the imperial throne of Emperor Kogyoku)

sen.j: 持統天皇（在位686年～697年）（第41代）
sen.e: Emperor Jito (her reign was 686 - 697) (the forty first)
Emperor Jito (her reign was 686 - 697) (the forty first)
Emperor Jito (her reign was 686 - 697) (the forty first)

sen.j: 元明天皇（在位707年～715年）（第43代）
sen.e: Emperor Genmei (her reign was 707 - 715) (the forty third)
Emperor Genmei (her reign was 707 - 715) (the forty third)
Emperor Genmei (her reign was 707 - 715) (the forty third)

sen.j: 元正天皇（在位715年～724年）（第44代）
sen.e: Emperor Gensho (her reign was 715 - 724) (the forty fourth)
Emperor Gensho (her reign was 715 - 724) (the forty fourth)
Emperor Gensho (her reign was 715 - 724) (the forty fourth)

sen.j: 孝謙天皇（在位749年～758年）（第46代）
sen.e: Emperor Koken (her reign was 749 - 758) (the forty six)
Emperor Koken (her reign was 749 - 758) (the forty six)
Emperor Koken (her reign was 749 - 758) (the forty six)

sen.j: 称徳天皇（在位764年～770年）（第48代、孝謙天皇の重祚）
sen.e: Emperor Shotoku (her reign was 764 - 770) (the forty eighth)
Emperor Shotoku (her reign was 764 - 770) (the forty eighth)
Emperor Shotoku (her reign was 764 - 770) (the forty eighth, the second accession to the imperial throne of Emperor Koken)
sen.cmt: the second accession to the imperial throne of Emperor Koken補足

sen.e: Emperor Meisho (her reign was 1629 - 1643) (the hundred and ninth)
Emperor Meisho (her reign was 1629 - 1643) (the hundred and ninth)
Emperor Meisho (her reign was 1629 - 1643) (the hundred and ninth)

sen.j: 後桜町天皇（在位1762年～1770年）（第117代）
sen.e: Emperor Gosakuramachi (her reign was 1762 - 1770) (the hundred and seventeenth)
Emperor Gosakuramachi (her reign was 1762 - 1770) (the hundred and seventeenth)
Emperor Gosakuramachi (her reign was 1762 - 1770) (the hundred and seventeenth)

sen.j: ※神功皇后も天皇の代に数えることが近代以前は行われた。
sen.e: *Before the modern period the Empress Jingu was counted as successive Emperors.
*Before the modern period the Empress Jingu was counted among successive Emperors.
*Before the modern period the Empress Jingu was counted among successive Emperors.

sen.j: ※飯豊皇女は、古事記では履中天皇の娘、日本書紀では市辺押磐皇子の娘であるため公式には天皇とされていないが、扶桑略記に「第24代飯豊天皇」とあるため、天皇として扱うべきとの意見もある。
sen.e: Princess Iitoyo was not officially stated as Emperor as she was called daughter of Emperor Richu in Kojiki (Records of Ancient Matters), and was called as daughter of Prince Ichinobe no Oshihano in Nihon shoki (Chronicles of Japan), however she was called 'the twenty fourth Emperor Iitoyo' in Fusoryakki, and there were some opinions that she should be considered as Emperor.

Princess Iitoyo was not officially stated as Emperor as she was called the daughter of Emperor Richu in the Kojiki (Records of Ancient Matters), and was called the daughter of Prince Ichinobe no Oshihano in Nihon shoki (Chronicles of Japan), however she was called 'the twenty fourth Emperor Iitoyo' in Fusoryakki (A Brief History of Japan), and there were some of the opinion that she should be considered as Emperor.

Princess Iitoyo was not officially stated as Emperor as she was called the daughter of Emperor Richu in the Kojiki (Records of Ancient Matters), and was called the daughter of Prince Ichinobe no Oshihano in Nihon shoki (Chronicles of Japan), however she was called 'the twenty fourth Emperor Iitoyo' in Fusoryakki (A Brief History of Japan), and there were some of the opinion that she should be considered as Emperor.

sen.j: なお、上記の如く女性天皇とは単に女性の天皇を指す、個々の天皇の性別についての言葉であるが、語句の類似性から女系天皇と混同されることが多い。
sen.e: By the way the female emperor simply means female emperor, but sometimes the word, female emperor can be understood as emperor of female line since it has the similar meaning to it.
By the way a female emperor simply means female emperor, but sometimes the word, female emperor can be understood as emperor of the female line since it has a similar meaning.
By the way a female emperor simply means female emperor, but sometimes the word, female emperor can be understood as emperor of the female line since it has a similar meaning.

sen.j: しかしながら、女系天皇とはその天皇自身の性別に関わらず母方から皇室の血統を受け継ぐという血筋についての言葉である（したがって女系の男性天皇・女系の女性天皇の両方があり得る）ため、両者は本質的に異なる概念である。
sen.e: However the Female Emperor means the Imperial members who succeed the Imperial blood line from these maternal relatives, and this does not concern whether the Emperor herself/himself is male or female, (Thus, there are both male and female emperors in female line exist.) so Female Emperor and Emperor of female line are basically two different words with different concept.

However Female Emperor means the Imperial members who succeed the Imperial blood line from these maternal relatives, and this does not concern whether the Emperor herself/himself is male or female, (Thus, there are both male and female emperors existing in the female lineage) so Female Emperor and Emperor of the female lineage are basically two different words with different concepts.

However female Emperor means the Imperial members who succeed the Imperial blood line from these maternal relatives, and this does not concern whether the Emperor herself/himself is male or female, (Thus, there are both male and female emperors existing in the female lineage) so female Emperor and Emperor of the female lineage are basically two different words with different concepts.

tit.j: 女性天皇に関する動き
tit.e: The movement in relation to the Female Emperor
The movement in relation to Female Emperors
The movement in relation to female Emperors

sen.j: 現行の皇室典範第1条には、「皇位は、皇統に属する男系の男子が、これを継承する。
sen.e: According to the Clause 1 of the current Imperial Family [Household] Law, it is said 'the male Imperial member of the Imperial family of male line should succeed to the throne'.
According to Clause 1 of the current Imperial Family [Household] Law, it is said 'the male Imperial member of the Imperial family in the male lineage should succeed to the throne.'
According to Clause 1 of the current Imperial House Act, it is said 'the male Imperial member of the Imperial Family in the male lineage should succeed to the throne.'

sen.j: 」と定められており、前例のない女系天皇はもとより過去に例のある男系女性天皇もまた認められていない。
sen.e: Not only female Emperor is not allowed to succeed to the throne which there is no example in the history, but also female emperor in male line is not allowed to succeed to the throne.
Not only a female is not allowed to succeed to the throne which there is no example in history, but also female in male lineage is not allowed to succeed to the throne.
Not only a female is not allowed to succeed to the throne which there is no example in history, but also female in male lineage is not allowed to succeed to the throne.

sen.j: この「女系」（血筋）と「女性」（性別）との二重の否定が、結果的に両者を混同させる一因になっているともいえよう。
sen.e: The way to deny the Imperial succession of both Female Emperor and the Emperor of the female line may have caused the confusion to understand the meaning of two different concept of the words.
The way to deny Imperial succession of both a Female and the Emperor of the female lineage may have caused the confusion to understand the meaning of two different concepts of these words.
The way to deny Imperial succession of both a female and the Emperor of the female lineage may have caused the confusion to understand the meaning of two different concepts of these words.

sen.j: しかしながら、皇族男子は秋篠宮文仁親王以来、40年間誕生せず、皇太子徳仁親王の第一子も内親王である敬宮愛子内親王であったことから、女性天皇や女系天皇を認めるように皇室典範を改正しようとする動きが見られていた（皇位継承問題を参照）。
sen.e: However there was no male Imperial successor was born in the family since Akishinonomiya Imperial Prince Fumihito, for forty years, in addition to this, Crown Prince, Imperial Prince Naruhito's first child was the Toshinomiya Imperial Princess Aiko, there was movement to revise the Imperial Family Law to allow Female Emperors or Emperors in female line to succeed to the Imperial Throne. (Please refer to the issue of the Imperial Succession)

However there were no male Imperial successors born into the family since Akishinonomiya Imperial Prince Fumihito, for forty years, in addition to this, the Crown Prince, Imperial Prince Naruhito's first child was the Toshinomiya Imperial Princess Aiko, there was a movement to revise the Imperial Family Law to allow Female Emperors or Emperors in female lineage to succeed to the Imperial Throne. (Please refer to the issue of Imperial Succession)

However there were no male Imperial successors born into the family since Imperial Prince Akishinonomiya Fumihito, for forty years, in addition to this, the Crown Prince, Imperial Prince Naruhito's first child was the Toshinomiya Imperial Princess Aiko, there was a movement to revise the Imperial House Act to allow female Emperors or Emperors in female lineage to succeed to the Imperial Throne. (Please refer to the issue of Imperial Succession)

sen.j: 2006年9月に41年ぶりの男性皇族である秋篠宮悠仁親王が誕生したが、若い男性皇族不足が解決されたわけでもないため、皇位継承問題は終わっていない（問題を先送りしただけ）とする意見がある。
sen.e: In September 2006, the male Imperial member, Akishinonomiya Imperial Prince Hisahito was born for the first time in forty one years, however the issue of the shortage of male Imperial member was yet unsolved, the Imperial succession problem still remains the same.

In September 2006, the male Imperial member, Akishinonomiya Imperial Prince Hisahito was born for the first time in forty one years, however the issue of the shortage of male Imperial members was yet unsolved, the Imperial succession problem still remains the same.

In September 2006, the male Imperial member, Imperial Prince Akishinonomiya Hisahito was born for the first time in forty one years, however the issue of the shortage of male Imperial members was yet unsolved, the Imperial succession problem still remains the same.

sen.j: さらには、女性天皇が積極的に容認されない事情に「神道儀礼」の問題がある。
sen.e: Furthermore, the reason why the Female Emperor was not positively accepted was because of the issue in terms of 'Shintoism ceremony'.
Furthermore, the reason why the idea of a Female Emperor was not positively accepted was because of the issue in terms of 'Shinto ceremony.'
Furthermore, the reason why the idea of a female Emperor was not positively accepted was because of the issue in terms of 'Shinto ceremony.'

sen.j: 皇室が行う神道儀礼には女性が行うことが出来ない儀礼が多種存在する。
sen.e: There are many type of ceremonies of 'Shitoism ceremony' held at the Imperial Palace which women were not allowed to attend.
There are many types of Shinto ceremonies held at the Imperial Palace in which women were not allowed to attend.
There are many types of Shinto ceremonies held at the Imperial Palace in which women were not allowed to attend.

sen.j: 歴代女性天皇もその行事のみは中止していた。
sen.e: Even the successive female emperors cancelled that kind of the ceremony.
Even the successive female emperors cancelled that kind of the ceremony.
Even the successive female emperors cancelled that kind of the ceremony.

sen.j: 現今の女性天皇の議論において「神道儀礼」について加味されないのは、祭祀継承を旨とする天皇家を無視すると言う批判もある。
sen.e: In the current argument of the Female Emperors, since 'Shitoism ceremony' was not discussed in the argument, there are some criticism that it had no consideration of the Imperial family who succeed the ritual.
In the current argument about Female Emperors, since the 'Shinto ceremony' was not discussed, there is some criticism that there was no consideration by the Imperial family who succeeded the ritual.
In the current argument about female Emperors, since the 'Shinto ceremony' was not discussed, there is some criticism that there was no consideration by the Imperial Family who succeeded the ritual.

tit.e: The role of the Female Emperor
The role of the Female Emperor
The role of the female Emperor

sen.j: 一般的には記紀の記述を尊重し、過去に存在した女性天皇は何れも男系の女性天皇であり、また女性天皇が皇族男子以外と結婚して産んだ子が皇位を継いだことは一度としてないとされている。
sen.e: Generally the description of the Kojiki (Records of Ancient Matters) and the Nihonshoki (Chronicles of Japan) was respected for the details of the Female Emperors, all the Female Emperors in the history were female emperor of the male line, there was no example of the female emperors married to non Imperial members and her children succeed to the Imperial succession.

Generally the descriptions in the Kojiki (Records of Ancient Matters) and the Nihonshoki (Chronicles of Japan) were respected for the details on Female Emperors, all the Female Emperors in history were female emperor of the male lineage, there were no examples of female emperors married to non Imperial family members with her children succeeding to the throne.

Generally the descriptions in the Kojiki (Records of Ancient Matters) and the Nihonshoki (Chronicles of Japan) were respected for the details on female Emperors, all the female Emperors in history were female emperor of the male lineage, there were no examples of female emperors married to non Imperial Family members with her children succeeding to the throne.

sen.j: 歴史学界では、女性天皇は皇統（皇室の男子血統）の断絶を忌避し、男系での継承を維持したという「女帝中継ぎ論」が通説である。
sen.e: In the academic world of the history, there is a generally known theory of 'The Female Emperor's temporally Imperial succession' to avoided the discontinuation of the Imperial succession of the Imperial line (Imperial male line), and to keep the Imperial succession in the male line.

Throughout history, there is the generally known theory of 'Female Emperor's temporarily succeeding to avoided the discontinuation of the Imperial lineage (Imperial male line), and to keep the Imperial succession in the male line.

Throughout history, there is the generally known theory of 'female Emperor's temporarily succeeding' to avoided the discontinuation of the Imperial lineage (Imperial male line), and to keep the Imperial succession in the male line.
